info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 5:07PM CDT until August 18 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following county, DuPage.
* WHEN...Until 815 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Roads and streets may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 506 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving into the area with rain rates exceeding 2 inches per hour. Flooding may begin shortly after the onset of heavy rainfall. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Chicago, Aurora, Naperville, Elgin, Schaumburg, Bolingbrook, Wheaton, Downers Grove, Elmhurst, Lombard, Bartlett, Streamwood, Carol Stream, Hanover Park, Addison, Glendale Heights, Elk Grove Village, St. Charles, Woodridge and Glen Ellyn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT THIS EVENING
